verses.text:
When I shall wake in that fair realm of glory,
And with the ransomed stand before the throne,
I'll drop my cross, take up my crown and harp,
And claim the victor's prize - won;
I shall gaze up-on the face of him, Perfect in wisdom from the cross of woe, And praise his ho-ly name,
For I shall know as I am known.

chorus.text:
Lay - e - ter-nal hope,
On the beau-ti-ful shore,
I shall be - - satis-fied then,
But for more of years, I shall be - satis-fied then,
I shall be satis-fied then,
I shall be satis-fied then.
